author: Tom Gentr
philosophy: Activities directed toward making a profit through satisfying consumer wants with tobacco products

notes.note: 35% of smokers smoke more because they have more time.

Marlboro could aim at the 35% smoker group since they have the majority of 18 to growth (50%) compared to Winston (6%). Marlboro loses 1/2 of 18 to between 18-25 years of age. Winston loses less and the rest goes to Camel.
Marlboro could increase revenue through price break.
Switching is cut in between Marlboro and Newport among 18 to smokers. PM may have tried to target this group with Northwind.
Out of stock causes 4% of Winston smokers to switch to other brands. Out of stock switching is greater among brands with smaller share.
Switching especially occurs among those who do not care to hunt for their usual brand.

additional_notes: We can be losing share volume because we do not effectively cover our sales areas which puts undue pressure on R&D. We may not be getting full benefit of our efforts.
